Question: Can a Non-U.S. Citizen Join the United States Military?

Answer: Yes. A non-citizen can enlist in the military. However, federal law prohibits non-citizens from becoming commission or warrant officers. In order for a non-citizen to enlist in the military, he/she must first be a legal immigrant (with a green card), permanently residing in the United States.

Cost of British passport to increase

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-42860723

The price of a British passport is to rise by £12.50 from 27 March for those applying by post.

Currently, an adult's passport costs £72.50 regardless of how you apply for it but under government plans this would rise by 17% up to £85.

The cost of online applications will also go up - but only by £3 to £75.50.

Did you get your British Citizenship via your parent in the British Nationality Selection Scheme (居英權計劃) in the 1990's?
